page.lettertext:
6 Decemb
r
1588
L
re
from M
r
Secretary Wals:
fol.305r
Belgia. 1588 6 Decem
b
to M
r
Bodley
S
r
: I send you herew
th
a l
re
to
Counte Maurice
and
the
states of Hollande
written by one
M
r
Adrian
Garania
a very honest and leaned preacher sometime
Recto
r
of the univ
r
sitie of
Leyden
and nowe by my
meanes resident upon a cure here in
England
. He
desireth onely that a Wrongfull sentence pronounced
against him by the Magistrat
of Leyden may be
reversed so that his creditt in his owne Countrey
is greatly touched by their injurious proceading
.
And therefore I pray yow to presse the sayd Count
and states to doe somewhat in the cause for that
it is very hard measure, that a man of his
desert shoulde sustyne so great a reproche w
th
out
cause: a matter that greaveth him the more in
respect of his inocency. For w
ch
purpose you
may conferre w
th
M
r
Gylpin
what cowrse is
to be taken. Whereby the states upon [true] informa-
tion may be induced to repeale the former sentence
Wherein I pray yow to doe yo
r
best indevo
r
.
And
so doe bydd you hartely farewell From the
Cowrt
at Grenew
ch
the vj
th
of Decemb
r
1588
Yo
r
assured frende Francis Walsyngham
M
r
Adrians l
re
to Count
Maurice and the stat
was
delivered unto you before
yo
r
Departure from hence.
